What’s not being pointed out in most of these conversations about what some parents consider “heavy” topics; these concerns can be alleviated by actual parenting. It’s not an educator’s job to specifically cater to every parent’s point of view. If their child brings home something they don’t like, they can tell the child why they don’t agree, discuss it with them and send them back for another book. That’s what’s called a “teachable moment” in families and education. When a parent says a topic is “too heavy” they mean they don’t want to address it or tell the child why.
